noun.description: An act of slaughtering an animal or person or surrendering a possession as an offering to God or to a divine or supernatural figure.
examples: they offer sacrifices to the spirits
the ancient laws of animal sacrifice

verb.description: Offer or kill as a religious sacrifice.
examples: the goat was sacrificed at the shrine

origin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin sacrificium; related to sacrificus sacrificial, from sacer holy.
